STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
December 7, 2020
Stephanie Dettloff
Child & Family Services - Northeast Michigan
1044 US-23 N
Alpena, MI 49707
RE: License #: CB040201041
Child & Family Services - Northeast Michigan
1044 US-23 N
Alpena, MI 49707
Dear Ms. Dettloff:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
December 2, 2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of
the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 For repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Claudia Triestram Area Manager, at 616-552-3662.
Sincerely,
Doug Turrill, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 11
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 383-5531
enclosure
2

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RENEWAL INSPECTION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CB040201041
Licensee Name: Child Family Services of NE Michigan
Licensee Address: 1044 US-23 N
Alpena, MI 49707
Licensee Telephone #: 989-356-4567
Administrator/Licensee Designee: Stephanie Dettloff, Designee
Name of Facility: Child & Family Services - Northeast Michigan
Facility Address: 1044 US-23 N
Alpena, MI 49707
Facility Telephone #: (989) 356-4567
Original Issuance Date: 05/01/1990
Service Types: PLACE CHILDREN FOR ADOPTION
CERTIFY FOSTER HOMES FOR LICENSE
SUPERVISE INDEPENDENT LIVING
PLACE CHILDREN IN FOSTER HOME
EVALUATE APPLICANTS FOR ADOPTION
1

Date of On-site Inspection(s): November 4, 16, 2020 and December 2, 3, 2020.

3

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
R 400.12212 Personnel records.
(3) The personnel record shall contain both of the
following:
(a) A written evaluation of a staff member’s performance
within a probationary period or not later than 6 months
after the staff member assumes his or her current
responsibilities. After the initial evaluation, a written
evaluation shall be conducted each year.
Four employee files were reviewed. Four of 4 files contained employee performance
evaluations that were overdue. One file documented that last evaluation was
completed on August 8, 2019. A second file documented that the last evaluation was
completed on June 28, 2019. A third file did not contain a 6 month probationary
evaluation. A fourth file documented that the last evaluation was completed on
August 23, 2019.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each
child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
Four files and 9 service plans were reviewed. One of 4 files did not have a PATP
uploaded for a service plan that was due on October 7, 2020. The PATP was
completed but not uploaded until December 2, 2020. This is a fourth repeat
violation. The original violation was established during the renewal inspection
completed on 11/20/17 and an acceptable CAP was received on 12/19/17. A repeat
violation was established during the interim inspection completed on 07/26/18 and
an acceptable CAP was received on 10/01/18. A second repeat violation was
established during the renewal inspection completed on January 15, 2019 and an
acceptable CAP was received on February 19, 2019. A third repeat violation was
established during the Interim Inspection completed on February 3, 2020 and an
acceptable CAP was received on March 16, 2020.
R 400.12413 Medical and dental policy.
(1) An agency’s medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(c) A physical examination for each child as follows, unless
a greater frequency is medically indicated:
4

(ii) For a child 2 years of age or older, a physical
examination shall have been completed within 12 months
before placement or a new physical examination shall be
completed within 30 calendar days after placement.
Four files and 9 service plans were reviewed. One of 4 files did not document that
the foster child received a physical exam by the due date of August 1, 2020. The
exam was completed on September 1, 2020, however it was past due. This is a
repeat violation. The original violation was established during the Interim Inspection
completed on February 3, 2020 and an acceptable CAP was received on March 16,
2020.
R 400.12413 Medical and dental policy.
f) The provision of a dental examination and any treatment
required for each child who is 4 years of age and older,
including both of the following:
(ii) A dental reexamination shall be obtained at least every
18 months, unless a greater frequency is indicated.
Four files and 9 service plans were reviewed. Two of 4 files did not contain current
dental exams. A dental exam was due for one foster child on October 1, 2020 and
the file did not contain documentation that this exam was completed. A second file
did not contain a dental exam which was due on November 16, 2020. This is a
second repeat violation. The original violation was established during the renewal
inspection completed on January 15, 2019 and an acceptable CAP was received on
February 19, 2019. A repeat violation was established during the Interim Inspection
completed on February 3, 2020 and an acceptable CAP was received on March 16,
2020.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the
following:
ISEP 6.33 Assessments and service plans.
Service plans shall be signed by the caseworker, the
caseworker’s supervisor, the parent(s), and the child(ren), if
of age to participate. If the parent(s) or child(ren) or both
are not available or decline to sign the plan, the service
plan shall include an explanation of the steps taken to
involve them and shall identify any follow-up actions to be
taken to secure their participation in services.
5

Four files and 9 service plans were reviewed. One of 4 files lacked parental
signatures on a PATP dated October 7. The file also contained a PATP dated July
15, 2020 which did not document the parental signature until September 1, 2020.
The signature was late. This is a repeat violation. The original violation was
established during the Interim Inspection completed on February 3, 2020 and an
acceptable CAP was received on March 16, 2020.
ISEP 4.49 Medical passports.
At the time the child is placed or re-placed, the foster care
provider shall receive the child’s Medical Passport, which
must contain the information required by MCL 722.954c(2)
and DHHS Policy FOM 801 (dated 3-1-2015) (or any
successor policies approved by the Monitors). And at least
quarterly thereafter, an updated Medical Passport must be
prepared, as required by the “Medical Passports” section
of DHHS Policy FOM 801 (dated 3-1-2015) (or any successor
policy approved by the Monitors), and provided to the
foster care provider.
Four files and 9 service plans were reviewed. Two of four files lacked updated
passports. In one file the passports for June 12, 2020 and March 8, 2020 were
completed but not uploaded. In a second file there were no uploaded passports from
the September 28, 2019, to June 11, 2020 time period. This is a fourth repeat
violation. The original violation was established during the renewal inspection
completed on 11/20/17 and an acceptable CAP was received on 12/19/17. A repeat
violation was established during the interim inspection completed on 07/26/18 and
an acceptable CAP was received on 10/01/18. A second repeat violation was
established during the renewal inspection completed on January 15, 2019 and an
acceptable CAP was received on February 19, 2019. A third repeat violation was
established during the Interim Inspection completed on February 3, 2020 and an
acceptable CAP was received on March 16, 2020.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
FOM 722-08C Parent Agency Treatment Plans.
The individual activities required by the foster
parent/caregiver to meet the specific individual needs of
the child placed in their home are included in the PATP.
The foster parent/caregiver must be included in the PATP
process. The foster parent/caregiver signature is required
and indicates that the foster parent/caregiver
6

acknowledges and agrees to the activities required to meet
the needs of the child in their care. Additionally, the PATP
details the services and activities provided by the foster
care worker to assist the foster parent/caregiver in caring
for the child.
Four files and 9 service plans were reviewed. Three of 4 files reviewed contained
one or more PATP’s that did not document signatures, or they were signed late. One
file contained a PATP dated October 28, 2020 that did not have foster
parent/caregiver signatures. A second file contained a PATP dated August 4, 2020
that was signed late on September 18, 2020. A third file contained a PATP dated
October 7, 2020 that did not document signatures. The same file contained a PATP
dated July 15, 2020 that was signed late on September 9, 2020. This is a fourth
repeat violation. The original violation was established during the renewal
inspection completed on 11/20/17 and an acceptable CAP was received on
12/19/17. A repeat violation was established during the interim inspection
completed on 07/26/18 and an acceptable CAP was received on 10/01/18. A second
repeat violation was established during the renewal inspection completed on
January 15, 2019 and an acceptable CAP was received on February 19, 2019. A
third repeat violation was established during the Interim Inspection completed on
February 3, 2020 and an acceptable CAP was received on March 16, 2020.
FOM 722-06H Case Contacts
The caseworker must enter the required face-to-face
contacts listed below in MISACWIS within five business
days of the contact. This includes attempted and missed
face-to-face contacts.
Four files and 9 service were reviewed. One of 4 files contained three contacts that
were entered late. A September 3, 2020 contact was entered on September 15,
2020. A July 22. 2020 contact was entered on July 29, 2020. A July 2, 2020 contact
was entered on July 13, 2020. This is a repeat violation. The original violation was
established during the Interim Inspection completed on February 3, 2020 and an
acceptable CAP was received on March 16, 2020.
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting
Initial Case Plan (ISP) - within 30 calendar days before the
case plan due date. Note: This FTM may be combined with
the CPS Case Opening (ISP) FTM. Updated Case Plan (USP)
- within 30 calendar days before the case plan due date.
7

Four files and 9 service plans were reviewed. Two of 4 files either did not contain
documentation of an FTM or FTM’s were not held within the required time frames. In
one file an FTM was held on June 2, 2020. The service plan was due May 11, 2020.
The FTM was late and was required to be held within 30 days of the case service
plan due date. A second file documented that a FTM was held on June 8, 2020 and
the service plan was due July 16, 2020. The FTM was held outside oof the 30 day
requirement. The file also did not document that an FTM was held for the case
service plan dated January 21, 2020 to April 18, 2020. This is a fourth repeat
violation. The original violation was established during the renewal inspection
completed on 11/20/17 and an acceptable CAP was received on 12/19/17. A repeat
violation was established during the interim inspection completed on 07/26/18 and
an acceptable CAP was received on 10/01/18. A second repeat violation was
established during the renewal inspection completed on January 15, 2019 and an
acceptable CAP was received on February 19, 2019. A third repeat violation was
established during the Interim Inspection completed on February 3, 2020 and an
acceptable CAP was received on March 16, 2020.
FOM 722-15 DHS-69, Foster Care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary -
Case Closing
The DHS-69, Foster Care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary,
must be completed at the time of program closure; see
FOM 722-08E, Foster Care/Juvenile Justice Action
Summary.
Two closed files were reviewed. Two of 2 files did not contain a DHHS -69 Action
Summary closing the case.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Not required.
V. CONSULTATION
Consultation was not requested of offered at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
8

period.
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. On March 16, 2020, the agency submitted
an acceptable corrective action plan in response to those violations established
during the Interim Inspection completed February 3, 2020. There were no complaints
against the agency during the licensing period therefore no special investigations
were initiated.
The DCWL field analyst conducted home visits and no safety violations were found.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
December 3, 2020
________________________________________
Doug Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
December 7, 2020
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
